# Code Along in Python: Coffee Table

Setting up.

```{python}
import polars as pl
import polars.selectors as cs
from great_tables import GT, loc, style
```

Importing the data.

```{python}
coffee_sales = pl.DataFrame.deserialize("data/coffee-sales.json", format="json")

coffee_sales
```

`GT()`

```{python}
gt_tbl = GT(______) # <- what do we introduce to GT()?

gt_tbl
```

## Adding Structure to the Table

`.tab_header()`

```{python}
gt_tbl = gt_tbl.tab_header(title="Sales of Coffee Equipment")

gt_tbl
```

`.tab_spanner()`

```{python}

gt_tbl = (
    gt_tbl
    .tab_spanner(label="Revenue", columns=cs.starts_with("revenue"))
    .tab_spanner(label="Profit", columns=cs._starts_with_("______")) # <- ?
)

gt_tbl
```

`.cols_label()`

```{python}
gt_tbl = (
    gt_tbl
    .cols_label(
        icon="______", # <- We want no label above the icon
        product="Product",
        revenue_dollars="Amount",
        profit_dollars="Amount",
        revenue_pct="Percent",
        profit_pct="Percent",
        monthly_sales="Monthly Sales"
    )
)

gt_tbl
```

## Formatting Values Within the Table Body

`.fmt_currency()`

```{python}
gt_tbl = (
    gt_tbl
    .fmt_currency(
        columns=cs.______("______"), # <- Need to select columns here
        use_subunits=False
    )
)

gt_tbl
```

`.fmt_percent()`

```{python}
gt_tbl = (
    gt_tbl
    .fmt_percent(
        columns=cs.ends_with("______"), # <- What string do we use?
        decimals=0
    )
)

gt_tbl
```

## Styling the Table

`.tab_style()` - 1

```{python}
gt_tbl = (
    gt_tbl
    .tab_style(
        style=style.fill(color="aliceblue"),
        locations=loc.body(columns=cs.______("revenue")) # <- ?
    )
)

gt_tbl
```

`.tab_style()` - 2

```{python}
gt_tbl = (
    gt_tbl
    .tab_style(
        style=style.______(color="papayawhip"), # <- fn for specifying a fill?
        locations=loc.body(columns=cs.______("profit")) # <- ?
    )
)

gt_tbl
```

`.tab_style()` - 3

```{python}
gt_tbl = (
    gt_tbl
    .tab_style(
        style=style.text(weight="bold"),
        locations=loc.body(rows=pl.col("product") == "______"), # <- What str?
    )
)

gt_tbl
```

## Adding a Column of Nanoplots

`.fmt_nanoplot()`

```{python}
gt_tbl = (
    gt_tbl
    .fmt_nanoplot(
        columns="monthly_sales",
        plot_type="bar"
    )
)

gt_tbl
```

## Adding Images to the Table

`.fmt_image()`

```{python}
gt_tbl = (
    gt_tbl
    .fmt_image(
        columns="icon",
        path="img/"
    )
)

gt_tbl
```

## Making Some Final Tweaks

`.sub_missing()`

```{python}
gt_tbl = gt_tbl.sub_missing(missing_text="")

gt_tbl
```
